chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
All charges against Vernon Lewis Coleman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vernon Lewis Coleman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Vernon Lewis Coleman.  Attorney Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Received and Filed. Motion to Deny Admission of 911 Recording

Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Vernon Lewis Coleman.  Attorney Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 9/12/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in court, appear in person with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appear in person . Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Vernon Lewis Coleman in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Vernon Lewis Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.
